str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To fill, fulfill, complete. A prolonged form of a primary pleo to 'fill' (imbue, influence, supply); specially, to fulfil.
From zeo; properly, heat, i.e. 'zeal' (figuratively, of God), or an enemy, malice).

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From blasphemos; to vilify; specially, to speak impiously.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To speak or say in opposition, contradict (oppose, resist). From anti and lego; to dispute, refuse.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Neuter Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
